segment.source: How to Manage URL Redirection by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager
segment.target: How to Manage URL Redirection by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager

segment.source: How to Manage URL Redirection by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager
segment.target: How to Manage URL Redirection by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager

segment.source: How to Manage URL Redirection by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager
segment.target: How to Manage URL Redirection by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager

segment.source: You can use the MED-V Workspace Packager to manage URL redirection in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: You can use the MED-V Workspace Packager to manage URL redirection in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: To manage web address redirection in a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To manage web address redirection in a MED-V workspace

segment.source: To open the MED-V Workspace Packager, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: To open the MED-V Workspace Packager, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: On the MED-V Workspace Packager main panel, click Manage Web Redirection.
segment.target: On the MED-V Workspace Packager main panel, click Manage Web Redirection.

segment.source: In the Manage Web Redirection window, you can type, paste, or import a list of the URLs that are redirected to Internet Explorer in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: In the Manage Web Redirection window, you can type, paste, or import a list of the URLs that are redirected to Internet Explorer in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: URL redirection in MED-V only supports the protocols HTTP and HTTPS.
segment.target: URL redirection in MED-V only supports the protocols HTTP and HTTPS.

segment.source: MED-V does not provide support for FTP or any other protocols.
segment.target: MED-V does not provide support for FTP or any other protocols.

segment.source: Enter each web address on a single line, for example:
segment.target: Enter each web address on a single line, for example:

segment.source: http://www.contoso.com/webapps/webapp1
segment.target: http://www.contoso.com/webapps/webapp1

segment.source: http://www.contoso.com/webapps/webapp2
segment.target: http://www.contoso.com/webapps/webapp2

segment.source: http://.contoso.com
segment.target: http://.contoso.com

segment.source: http://www.contoso.com/webapps/
segment.target: http://www.contoso.com/webapps/

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you import a text file that includes a URL that uses special characters (such as ~ !
segment.target: If you import a text file that includes a URL that uses special characters (such as ~ !

segment.source: @ and so on), make sure that you specify UTF-8 encoding when you save the text file.
segment.target: @ and so on), make sure that you specify UTF-8 encoding when you save the text file.

segment.source: Special characters do not import correctly into the MED-V Workspace Packager if the text file was saved using the default ANSI encoding.
segment.target: Special characters do not import correctly into the MED-V Workspace Packager if the text file was saved using the default ANSI encoding.

segment.source: Click Save as…
segment.target: Click Save as…

segment.source: to save the updated URL redirection files in the specified folder.
segment.target: to save the updated URL redirection files in the specified folder.

segment.source: MED-V creates a registry file that contains the updated URL redirection information.
segment.target: MED-V creates a registry file that contains the updated URL redirection information.

segment.source: Deploy the updated registry key by using Group Policy.
segment.target: Deploy the updated registry key by using Group Policy.

segment.source: For more information about how to use Group Policy, see Group Policy Software Installation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195931).
segment.target: For more information about how to use Group Policy, see Group Policy Software Installation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195931).

segment.source: MED-V also creates a Windows PowerShell script in the specified folder that you can use to re-create the updated MED-V workspace package.
segment.target: MED-V also creates a Windows PowerShell script in the specified folder that you can use to re-create the updated MED-V workspace package.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace
